I loved this place!  This was our first stop on our food tour.  It has a totally local feel and from our tour guide, the locals love stopping here before or after a meal for a snack and drink or even for their main meal.  We had vermouth with olives, tomato bread, jamon, cheese, and two kinds of anchovies.  Loved it!  And I enjoyed the personal service with great surroundings of everyday and vintage local products with historical wine taps from the walls and above.
